intro: Agatea salomonensis, commonly known as Solomon's agate, is a rare flowering plant native to the Solomon Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded understory environments of tropical rainforests. Its leaves are elliptical with a smooth surface, and it produces fragrant, white to pale yellow blooms. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
